I've been watching Anime about Romance/School since I was in high school but I'm gonna give this one a review. This is my first review in My Anime List and it have to be Tsuki ga Kirei. Sorry for my bad English, I'll try to do it as best as i could. Alright, Lets get started and please watch out for any spoiler alert:
Tsuki ga Kirei was aired in Spring 2017 and this is my second time watching it. I love this Anime not just because the romance. Everything about it is very great, the plot of the story, the characters voice & personalities, theopening & ending song with background music that was sing by Touyama Nao(also know as Chitoge voice actress) and the art is very simple & unique.\n\n
-Storyline: It's 9/10 for me.\n
-Art: Great.\n
-Sound-Good\n
-Character: Great, their personalities and voice really fit them well.\n
-Enjoyment: Great, one of my top 3 Romance Anime.\n
-Overall: Great, the best Anime so far just like Kimi no Nawa.

I have to say that this anime is genuinely breathtaking and if you're looking for a romance that isn't cliche and delivers a really powerful message with a great story you've came to the right place.
I'll conclude my review within the five sections. (Story, Art, Sound, Character, Enjoyment & Overall) I will try to keep this as spoiler-free as possible, but their may be a few occasional slip up's so be warned!
Story (9/10): So when I started this anime I did kind of expect it to be cliche off the bat seeing as the two MC's are introduced to eachother in a cliche fashion, butthe anime seems to take a more direct turn than prolonging where the story is trying to go and I really condeme this anime for doing that. What most romance animes accomplish in the span of the entire series; this anime manages to do in the matter of a few episodes and that's something fairly unique about this show. The story gets to the point and it's something I want in a show. I gave the story a 9/10 instead of full 10 because there were some points within the story where the pacing was a bit slow and it got on my nerves, but perhaps that's just me being impatient. Anywhom that concludes this section of the review.


Art (8/10): The art was beautiful & I am a sucker for colourful scenery which this anime is more than happy to use. It just makes the show much more satisfying to watch when you have vibrant colors & well drawn scenery  in every episode. The only issue I have with the art is the 3d art animation, the running etc, looked awkward as anything and out of place. This doesn't really ruin the immersion whatsoever but when they over-use the animation sometimes it's a little iffy in my opinion.


Sound (10/10): The soundtrack is beautiful and well used in the scenes they try to convey certain emotions in. The music made me feel tense in the intense situations, sad in the sad situations & happy in the happy situations. When a soundtrack has the ability to do that you know it's good. 10/10 for me completely.


Character (8/10): The characters for the most part are ACTUALLY relatable to? A lot of romances these days seem to set the boundaries so high that you unfortunatly can't relate to the MC because you feel like it's been set up so perfectly for them that it isn't a reality you could relate to. But this anime truly makes you relate to in many ways with how the MC feels and the situations hes put in. It feel's like the characters are so easy to relate to if you've ever had a crush on someone and just been anxious around that person you want to talk to. The best characters are the ones you can relate to & this show does a high amount of relating to.


Enjoyment (9/10): For practically the majority of the anime I found myself clinging on the back of my chair when situations got tense, smiling like a idiot when happy/soppy moments occured and finding myself sad when there would be emotional scenes & it's been a long time since a romance anime as managed to captivate me and pull me in as much as this one. Of course there were a few issues I stated out within sections of the review, but they arent that noticeable and I'm sure I'm being picky, but they don't take away from how amazing this anime is.


Overall (9/10): To me this is a must watch if you're a romance fanatic. It's a romance you can easily relate to and mkaes you feel for each character and look at it from their perspective. The only reason this gets a 9 instead of a 10 is because I think there are few minor details that could be touched up on and I think my main point relies on pacing being a little tedious in some instances, but they're minor and aren't consistant throughout the entire anime so this gets a solid 9 for me. As I said, a must watch.

**May contain spoilers**
''There's such a thing as love in this world. I'm sure of it.'' ~ Dazai
I had never heard of Tsuki Ga Kirei before and I'm sure I would never have found it if a certain someone hadn't recommended it to me. I didn't know what to expect and I must say I was pleasantly suprised. Now if you don't like romance or high school stories, then Tsuki ga Kirei is not for you and I suggest you watch something else.
Story - 9/10
Tsuki ga Kirei was an original, realistic and refreshing story about an high school romance. For a typical high school romance itreally stood out. The romance and dialogues were convincing and felt close to realistic. Even though towards the end it gets a bit cliché, I really enjoyed the story. Tsuki ga Kirei showed me that teenage years can be quite interesting and don't need dramatic events to keep me watching. That's why Tsuki ga Kirei is not comparable to Clannad/Angel Beats/Charlotte. I enjoyed the drama/romance in the 3 animes listed above, but they didn't feel realistic in my opinion. And that's where Tsuki ga Kirei shines as an original realistic take on high school romance. 


Art - 7/10

Tsuki ga Kirei was close to perfect (to me), if it wasn't for the sloppy animation. I really liked the art-style and the facial expressions were done extremely well. Such a shame that crowds or walking animations were absolutely terrible. I don't know the exact reason for this, but it didn't really affect the story in general. Still it could've been done much better.


Sound - 8/10

I don't quite remember anything of the soundtrack. Today I looked up some of the OST and I wasn't disappointed. Really emotional and moving soundtrack. 


Character - 9/10

As a main character Azumi was a very interesting, but not an original character. He's a typical shy kid with a regular group of friends. Mizuno on the contrary is a more popular and athletic character (shy nonetheless). The way these two characters fall in love was very much like how normal kids would fall in love. It starts with eye contact and before you know it they start texting everyday. (Texting is actually a very important theme in this anime and the use of LINE is necessary for this love-story to happen). Their conversations in real-life start out as awkward and contain lots of silences. However, the more the better they get to know each other the more they begin to open-up to one another. This leads to them eventually dating each other. I mentioned friends before, but I haven't mentioned the use of friends in Tsuki ga Kirei. Friends are actually a key-factor in this story. Both the Azumi and Mizuno started out as really embarassed about their relation and this led to many misunderstandings. Hearts were broken and friendships were almost lost. Even the use of parents and family in this anime was really realistic compared to other anime like (uhum) almost every other high school romance. With the exception of the two main characters I actually didn't care for many other characters. There were some other characters I liked, but they weren't interesting enough for me to actually care for them like I do for the main characters. 


Enjoyment - 9/10

In general I really enjoyed this anime and I was quite disappointed it was only 12 episodes. Nonetheless I liked how the story went and how it ended, so there is no need for a second season or sequel. I definitely learned a lot myself and it got me thinking about my own life. I'm in my final year of high school and next year I'm going to university (hopefully). I could relate to a lot of this anime and it's definitely worth a watch.


Overall - 9/10

Despite the horrible walking animations I would recommend Tsuki ga Kirei to anyone who enjoyes a good high school romance. If you're looking for an eventful and dramatic romance story, then Tsuki ga Kirei is not the anime for you and I would recommend Clannad or Charlotte. If you do enjoy a realistic high scool romance, then I definitely recommend this anime to you. Tsuki ga Kirei is a gem and deserves so much more attention, so I suggest you recommend this to your friends if you enjoyed it.

One of, if not the best romantic animes ever produced on screen. A story of childhood love that grasps the ordeals of what many of us had experienced when we were that age. An emotional bond that grips you from episode one and gives out the most powerful sense of awkwardness that comes from infatuation without needing to even a say a word.
Physical cues take centre stage here and it's incredibly natural and wholesome. It gives the person watching an intimate realization that these are actually two individuals trying to figure out their place in each other's world and the connection it provides is nothingless short of perfection.\n\n
I recommend this to anyone that likes anime. Dare I say anyone that likes to feel happy. This is that show. An epitome of a great and memorable story.

Tsuki ga Kirei is one of the very few animes that fit in the "pure romance" categories without having harem tags in it and its one of the best pure romance shows out there. If someone asked me to recommend them a romance show this would be my first choice. 
When i first started watching this show it was kind of slow paced and even boring at times (maybe because I just wasn't into it), but then after like a few episodes i really started to relate to this show like no other. The relationship and the progress of the relationship are just so realthat you won't ever find this kind of realism in other shows. Personally I have been in a relationship and god I relate to this show on so many levels. 


I'm not really a fan of the character designs, maybe a bit simplistic, maybe I've just seen too many anime movies, but i got used to the style at the end anyway. 


The music (Opening & Ending) oh my god they were so good, like i could imagine myself in this anime, in that kind of environment and feel myself apart of their school when i listen to the music, its very charming.


All in all, this show was very heartwarming and beautiful, if you're looking for some kind of pure romance, or even just a romance show, then this is a must watch!

Going into a romance show, I've had my experiences with white album 2 and toradora, where white album 2 was a love triangle done well, and toradora being 2 lovers that are blind. I was expecting a basic love triangle going into the show and came out with a smile on my face with emotions through the roof. Tsuki ga Kirei tells the story of 2 inexperienced lovers that are extremely shy, and have a respectable amount of privacy and room for
each other. This tells a different 
Story 9/10
Tsuki ga Kirei tells the story of 2 inexperienced lovers that are extremely shy and have arespectable amount of privacy and room for each other. This tells a different tale, as there is a rare chance of encountering fan service and avoids any sort of sexualization of anything. Where I feel the story, shines are the general themes of reality set throughout the story, seeing how they play a big factor where plots turn around, and how it affects the plot development. This show incredibly captures high school relationships, as a main way of communication for the main characters are using texts, or LINE in the show. Although this would seem like a boring turnaround for the show and be a lame and lazy way of holding conversations with no atmosphere, I feel its applaudable in this situation due to the lovers being shy and having trouble holding conversations, as it is how they open to each other more and indulge in each others life. 


Art 5/10

Mostly the reason why the art is so low is due to the CG in the show being extremely horrific. The creators being lazy put cg models for characters in crowds and in cutscenes, and it just ruined the mood. Having an emotional moment be ruined by everyone but the main characters being cg and looking super shit ruined it for me. 

Also, I didn't mind the character art and how they looked, it's somewhat basic but nothing too major.


Sound 7/10

The music is nice, but it isn't anything special that'll blow you out of the park. Some nice piano instrumentals, opening and ending is pretty good, but nothing spectacular.






Characters 8/10

Part of the reason I wasn't liking the show at first was because I saw a lack of character development and neither of them were trying to break out of their shyness. However, I soon noticed that they did include character development in there, they showed that they found out ways to work around it, and I loved it. Kotarou, being shy with talking likes to express his emotions through literature and uses it to express his true emotions on paper. Akane generally likes to demonstrate her emotions through LINE, building courage by squeezing her plush enough due to her anxiety, and finds enough courage to tell others about her relationship status. 

Akane can work through her anxiety and tell Kotarou how she feels, and Kotarou also finds courage to stand up for himself and give himself a goal to work for. One thing that Kotarou lacks in life is reasoning. He lacks the drive to do homework, spend quality time with his parents, he only spends time at the library and dance practice because he feels comfortable there. As soon as he finds a reason to do school work and be more efficient in life, you see Kotarou shine with his true colours, as you do with Akane.

The big reason I like the characters so much is how it can pass for a legitimate story, as the characters are realistic with how they work around their problems. It's not supposed to be all happy moments, as the tv show outcome is how it would happen in real life is super different, but this show shows a strong sense of reality in many of the outcomes in the show, won't say too much to spoil.

However, one thing the show lacks imo is a proper supporting cast. I understand having the center point be around Kotarou and Akane, but you can try and include Kotarou's line of friends into the story as well and play some sort of role. It seems that the show declares them as outcasts, and only puts them in moments to where they think is enough to classify them as supporting cast, but generally they had no effect on the story. Akane's did, but Kotarou's group of friends play no general meaning other than to stand there as blank silhouettes with the basic generalization of "supporting cast"


Due to the character development being different and each character having their sort of escape from reality that works into the plot are reasons that I admire the two main characters.

However, due to the lack equality for the supporting cast on Kotarou's side mainly it will bring the score down slightly.


Enjoyment 10/10

I generally enjoyed watching a good romance. The best one I’ve seen so far out of 4 different ones. Even though there are moments where I question the show, there are more moments where I am in awe at how well a show can capture the emotions of a quiet relationship and working around their limits. Although the Art isn't the best and ruins some parts, there is the story that makes up for it that gives it a twist on reality driven events, having the plot revolve around the sense of reality as well and what the true meaning of "love" is. Love is like the same question as "what is the meaning of life". There are different ways people can answer that based on their experiences living and going through everything they do. This show talks about Love as a reason. A reason to change, a goal to grasp, and something to work for as long as you live. It gives you life knowing that you have achieved "love" with someone people question in the show as "why him". The show generally doesn't answer that question, but it leaves you to answer it. Love is something that just happens. The second they laid eyes on each other they start blushing and becoming shy to one another, already sharing a emotional connection on a psychological plane. Love at first sight is what the show generally demonstrates, but loyalty coming along with it, having no doubts and achieving goals as a couple to make yourself the best people you can possibly be by maintaining a relationship with each other. 


Love gives Life a meaning.


Overall Rating 8/10

Looking at what truly makes the show shine I’d give this a 9 or even a 10/10 for being an awesome and enjoyable romance. However, due to key details being left out and the art and sound not being too good my overall rating is

8/10

thanks for reading

First of all, this review will be written in spanish, so if you don't understand it, you can leave.
Tsuki ga kirei. Un anime que si les soy sincera, me encantó al principio, aburrió, y finalmente terminó por atraparme nuevamente.
Es un anime que claramente no es el mejor, pero yo en este caso voy a hacer la review en un sentido diferente, yo voy a decir mi experiencia, lo que me provocó este anime y lo que sentí al verlo, no voy a meterme por caminos en los cuales me voy a perder como la animación y detalles así.
Como les dije, viendo este anime estuve frentea tres fases que las voy a denominar así: 1- La fase del descubrimiento. 2- La fase del aburrimiento. 3- La fase de la emoción.


1- Esto me sucedió cuando comencé a ver el anime. Me resultó muy bonita su historia y como avanzaban los hechos, y además, debido a que tengo la misma edad que los protagonistas, me sentía identificada con los sucesos que iban pasando.


La historia en el principio se centró más en mostrarnos como dos personas que casi no hablaban pueden volverse personas muy cercanas, y de como la tecnología está haciendo cambios en la sociedad, como les pasa a nuestros protagonistas, que hablan mucho por LINE, pero en la vida real no soy tan enérgicos y cómicos como en LINE.


A la primer fase la denominé descubrimiento, ¿Por qué?

Porque en los primeros capítulos el anime nos mostró como se iba a desarrollar esta historia. A mi me gustó, pero algo pasó en la segunda fase que me hizo flaquear.


2- Esta fase no sucedió porque quisiera, claramente. Fue algo que sucedió porque la trama se fue por un lado que medio me aburre, y también yo cometí algunos errores.


A mi siempre me pasa, que antes de ver un capítulo de anime, no puedo evitar ver los comentarios. Gran error. Nunca lo hagan. Primero, podés toparte con algún spoiler, cosa que es bastante horrible. Además, al fin y al cabo es tu culpa, puesto que si te aparece algún spoiler de ese capítulo en especial, esa persona no tiene la culpa, los comentarios están hechos para comentar sobre el capítulo, tú fuiste el idiota que decidió verlos antes.

Y lo segundo, que es lo que me pasa a mí, es que al ver de qué se trata el capítulo, no me gustaba y terminaba dejándolo para otro momento, alargando y alargando el tiempo de espera.


Con respecto a la trama, lo que no me gustó es que se metió medio que en el mundo del cliché romántico. Una chica gusta del prota, y un chico de la prota, gran cliché que sinceramente me tiene un poquito harta, porque ya sabemos cómo termina. Por cierto, otro punto, serie un poquito mucho predecible.


3- Finalmente, nos vamos a la etapa que más me hizo disfrutar del anime. Esta etapa, que contiene maso menos los últimos capítulos, es claramente lo mejor. Disfruté como nunca. Me gustó muchísimo cómo se fue desarrollando la historia, los protas parecían madurar conforme la historia pasaba, los sucesos de verdad eran emocionantes, se mostraron caras de los personajes que no habíamos visto, haciéndolos más reales, y también, habían muchas partes en las que lo hicieron lo más realista posible, haciéndonos mas cercanos a los protas y su entorno. Sin duda alguna, esta etapa está llena de sorpresas.


Y para terminar, quiero dar un muy buen punto a favor: el final.

Después de que terminó el anime, mostraron los créditos. Algo que me llamó la atención, es que habían textos de LINE al final, como signo de que esto no terminaba ahi. Seguí viéndolo por mera curiosidad, y me encontré con que nos seguían mostrando como fue avanzando la historia de los personajes luego del final. Me gustó mucho ese detalle del final, nada más que eso.


Respecto a la banda sonora, me pareció bastante buena. Yo algo que tengo es que cuando una banda sonora de verdad me gusta, mis oídos en vez de escuchar las voces, pasan a la música, por eso me doy cuenta de que bandas sonoras valen la pena. En este caso, no escuché mucho, pero un par de veces pude oír melodías para chuparse los dedos.


Eso es todo, y aunque me tiren piedras, yo considero a Tsuki ga Kirei junto con Ballroom e Youkoso, mis animes favoritos del 2017.

the final process of the story just jumps. should proceed to season 2, because those with an LDR might invite interesting issues to solve.\n\n
and also this parade scene is japanese culture? . I do not really understand the culture.\n
but I think the parade scene is good, because the cultural activities are not displayed once, but told regularly from the process of training to the actual parade.

This anime is a great watch, for me it brought up a lot of feels from first love and how it affects your life to preparation for exams and graduation. 
Art is great and tends to improve towards the last episodes. Character design is also great and characters act naturally when faced with different life choices .
However where the story lacks, is the time frame chosen for it. Had it been chosen at the end of hischool with graduation and university admission, it would have been more believable. Also it's a story of first love however it should have stopped before the end credits scene.The end credits scene should not have been added there, it makes the story less believable. Apart from this, it would have been a 10 in my book, factoring the above it's a 9. \n\n
Definitely recommended to watch for the feels depicted, you will definitely find a piece of yourself in this anime.

The very first anime in my entire list so far that managed to score a perfect 10 on all subject.
This anime starts in a very common setting. A school. The story revolves around two particular students which become the center of attraction for the story. The art is perfect for the set. The insert song, background music, OP, ED are a fitting match for the anime. I can go on and on about it but I'll cut it short
So, Tsuki ga Kirei. The perfect romance anime to ever exist. The story is heartwarming and sometimes viewer can relate to the MC. It's not overexaggerated oroverdramatic. There's no cliche character here. Everyone is like a new set of tropes detached from the rest of the tropes. It managed to pick the most overused setting in anime and turn that setting into a perfect love story. There's a mix of comedy and drama here and there to relax.\n\n
Let me warn you beforehand!\n
Do not watch this if you're a pretty emotional person with a particular background depicted in the show. You'll break yourself in the process. Still, I recommend this if you like a true romance drama with a good story minus cliffhanger

Tsuki ga Kirei is the best romantic anime I've ever seen. The first time I saw the page I was less interested so I try to see 1 episode only. But what a surprise when I saw the innocence of Akane Mizuno's face upon seeing Kotarou Azumi. From there I got interested to continue on to the next episode.
Starting from the story line, the song and especially the character of both of them are very plain and timid. Until now I am still watching this anime without boredom, even occasionally I wish I was Kotarou Mizuno figure who want to feel the direct love storyof both of them to have their own family.\n\n
A great work of art.
